author: Deleted User
content:
sorry just catching up on the chat so want to comment on 2 things <@!301186049323958275> 
1. bitcoin core for sure has supoprt for RBF, people use it, actually most clients/wallets _support it_
2. eip1559 does nothing against selfish mining to the best of my knowledge

author: sky.cactus
content: <@456226577798135808> I thought a while back a bunch of the clients stopped propagating RBF transactions?

author: sky.cactus
content: EIP-1559 removes a large chunk of the incentive for a particular type of selfish mining attack.

author: tkstanczak
content: imho, eip-1559 could be introduced in January

author: sky.cactus
content: That is far more aggressive that I would bet on, but I would support a push for January timeframe.

author: tkstanczak
content: just waiting for someone to tweet above

author: tkstanczak
content: will Tim R...n be ready with analysis by that time?

author: timbeiko
content: His work was supposed to take 3-4 months starting in August, IIRC, so possibly, yeah.

author: timbeiko
content: I think EIP-1559 can be "mainnet ready" by Jan, but it's not clear we'll have things like EIP-2929 on the network at that point

author: sky.cactus
content: I'm no longer convinced that is necessary.

author: sky.cactus
content: The average block size is not changing, and the belief is that the known attacks are linear with gas, and there is not an expectation that nodes will fall over when attacked (just fall behind).  The net effect is that the worst case scenario (within reason given the above) is that during times of increasing congestion *some* nodes will fall a bit behind but they will then catch back up during times of decreasing congestion.

author: sky.cactus
content: To a be a bit more clear.  I think 2929 is necessary.  I don't think 1559 has a hard dependency on it.  I think 2929 should be a priority if we have to choose between the two though.

author: timbeiko
content: Process-wise, 2929 is already "mostly done", too. So I don't really see a world where 1559 ends up on mainnet before it
